newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP sees 97 sales getting forex boost.
newsitem.headline: SAP sees 97 sales getting forex boost.

text.p: The chief financial officer of German software house SAP AG, Dieter Matheis, said on Thursday the company stood to see sales get a boost from the current weakness of the mark.
Speaking at the company's annual news conference, Matheis said, "if the dollar and pound remain at current levels, we expect 10 to 12 percentage points more revenue growth than originally forecast.
Matheis said based on the original projection for 25 to 30 percent growth, revenue could grow 37 to 42 percent if the currencies remain at these levels.
The original forecast was based on a dollar value of 1.50 marks.
In the first half of the year, SAP had 995 million marks in sales in North and South America, 100 million marks of those sales came from currency affects.
In the U.S. alone sales stood at 798 million marks, a third of the group's total sales.
